column5: That's one glittering eye!! cheers:)
trolling harnesses? lol  btw nice fish!  JP

Thanks Jay!!!   Thanks Simon!!!  Yeah at 2F it sure was a bit chilly before sunrise   Thanks Spiel!!!  Like you, it's my preferred way of catching them   Thanks Mike!!!  Yes 12" is the slot size in zone 10 West.   Thanks Mike!!!

Thanks corvette1!!!  It sure was   Thanks Glen!!!  Yeah the cold front sure put a damper on the bite but we still got into a few of them   Thanks Greg!!!  It sure is not normal for the temps to drop that low mid September.... but slow presentation was key in getting some stikes and want to thank you for that tip   Thanks Roy!!!   Thanks tightline!!! Once filleted, dropped them into the pan and they were real good   Thanks Dusky!!!   Thanks JP!!!  Trolling is another productive way but still prefer jigging for them
i would too if i actually caught one by jigging, haha.

The mission today was for Paul and I to head over to Lac St-Marie early morning til noonish to see if we could entice some eyes to hit our jigs.  Hadn't had a good feed of eyes for some time now and was really looking forward to it  Got up early and when I looked out the window..... this is what the reading on the thermometer was    2C Shock!!! Man talk about change of plan.... had to bring extra clothing for this trip     The good thing was, there was no wind.... Perfect!!!  Left home at 5:00am as usual, pit stop to Tims and the way we go.... Got to destination at around 6:15ish, launched to boat and proceeded to our favorite spot in the fog    Surface temp was 64.4F, positioned the boat and started drifting.... here's a pic of where we started    This area is a big weedy flat with some variation in water depth.... 10' to 15' is what you will find here with some underwater holes that reach to 30'  Didn't take long for Paul to land this beauty.... just over the slot size 12" and change    Little one but was our first...  In the live well it goes...  Kept working the flats and got this pic of Paul working hard at it....    We did manage a few more but they were under the slot so back they went in a hurry  We then tried to work around the closest island and found a weedy hump.... on the hump was around 9' fow and on the one side dropping into 15'.... this is where I landed my biggest of the day.... a 19"er Here is the pic    We kept working the new found spot and got reward again with a 13"er    At around 12:30pm we called it a day..... All in all, we ended up catching 6 eyes and keeping 3.  Got into a few SMB's, perch and rock bass while jigging.  Lure of choice was a 1/4oz chartreuse jig dressed with a twister tail, tipped with a worm. Won't be the biggest feed but at least will be able to taste some Thanks Paul for an awesome time!!! Will have to do it again soon Hope you enjoy! Leechman
Now there is a pure Golden Nugget right there man!    Congrats to you and paul for a great outting.
Real Good Leechman  I was out for a bit today and just got a couple gators and a few perch--no willy's  Bushart
That picture should be in a pamphlet somewhere, it is a gorgeous shot. Nice job as always on the fishing and the report. Jim
Good fishing! What a difference in weather from here. it was something like 36 yesterday. wheres fall already
Come November,you,ll be be atching that it,s to warm.  Nice report bud.
Great hauling Jacques and Paul  Well done with a great report to boot!
Very nice  Joey
Nice fish. How did the boat launching and take-out go?  lol
Could have been better....
Nice fish and nice report budday!!  cheers HD
OOps.  that looks like about $120 launch ramp incident. Forgot to lift the motor? What size and pitch is it and number of splines?

Thanks Kev!!!  This is my biggest on softwater so far   Thanks bushart!!!   Thanks Jim!!!  Paul took that shot and I like it too!!!   Thanks troutologist!!! Yeah it felt more like winter this morning.... I was wearing a triple layer out in the boat for a while LOL   Thanks Brian!!!  I hear ya on that LOL   Thanks Mike!!!   Thanks Joey!!!   Thanks Chris!!!  No hickups this time I stayed cleared..... Paul did a fine job LOL   Hey Paul, where are the other pics???   Thanks Fidel!!!
Hey Jacques,  I hope the water temp was 64 degrees F not C.     !  Maybe you guys are fishing in hot springs.
HA.... yeah we were fishing in a hot tub   :lol: Thanks Chris for pointing that out.... It has been corrected
Nice fish once again guys!
good to see ya got into 'em Jacques, like somerone else said ...that pic of you with the big guy is top class.  keep up the good work.  Looks a bit chilly there at the moment....
Jigging for walleye, is there any other way?
Very nice Jacques. Is there an actual "slot" in your zone? In my part of QC it's a 12" minimum.
Nice job bud, I outta get catch myself some walleye one day!  Thanks for sharing, MTBF
congrats leechman looks like a great day on the water

Looks like a decent day of Pickeral fishing Jacques!!!  ... but I gotta tell ya, I would freeze to death in 35*F weather right now!!!  It sounds like that cold front up there made the fishin' slow... but it looks like you and Paul did well considering the conditions!!!  Thanks for taking the time to post those nice pic and report!!!

Great job and excellent pics leechman.  Nothing better then Stick'n some nice Walleye on jigs.  Temps have be cold the past few mornings and water temps are starting to drop... the action will slow down somewhat during the turnover then pic back up again for all us 'Diehards' out there..... Greg.
Some very nice fish and really super pics. Congrats to you both!
Great pic Leechman...what a beautiful clean looking fish...can taste him now with some fried potatoes and maple brown beans.....MMMM, MMMM, MM
